sentences.en: Artists personify beauty in their works.
sentences.cn: 艺术家在作品中表现美.

sentences.en: Carter personifies the values of self-reliance and hard work.
sentences.cn: 卡特身上体现了自立和勤劳的价值。

sentences.en: Do not threat, disturb, personify or hurt other people, and do not invade other people's privacy.
sentences.cn: 请勿恐吓 、 侵扰 、 侮辱、伤害他人, 请勿侵犯他人隐私.

sentences.en: People usually personify a ship by referring to it as'she ".
sentences.cn: 人们往往用 “ 她 ” 来称呼船使之拟人化.

sentences.en: She seemed to personify goodness and nobility.
sentences.cn: 她宛如善良和高贵的化身。

sentences.en: The personify the divine and magic powers worshipped by the people.
sentences.cn: 它们把人们崇拜的神力和魔力都人格化了.

sentences.en: The two main characters personify The Dollar and The Euro in this heavily symbolic experimental piece.
sentences.cn: 在这部华丽而有韵律的实验性的作品中,两个主人公分别象征了美元和欧元.

sentences.en: To attribute human or personal qualities to; personify.
sentences.cn: 拟人化赋予人类或个人的品质; 拟人化.

sentences.en: To make history or psychology alive I personify it ( Ana ? s Nin )
sentences.cn: 我将历史或心理人格化,使得它具体生动起来 ( 阿奈斯尼恩 )

words.tran_cn: 人格化；化身；拟人法（一种修辞手法）；象征
个性化（personalize的过去式）；个人化

trans.tran_en: to think of or represent a quality or thing as a person

trans.tran_cn: 人格化，拟人化，赋与…人性，象征，体现
